channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN

item.title: Report X-2023081121
item.description:
Report X-2023081121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: HAMMOND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BEING UNLOADED AND AS A RESULT CAUSED DAMAGED TO THE LID WHICH CREATED A SPILL DescribePack: THE LID WAS CRACKED AND CAUSED LEAKAGE ON THE TOP DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: AREA WAS CLOSED OFF, HAZMAT SPILL WAS CLEANED, AND ALL CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN THE DRUM AND PREPARED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023081172
item.description:
Report X-2023081172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called by manager to truck claiming truck had leaking hazmat package. Hazmat was found to be leaking, package removed from work area and placed in hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Upon inspection of Hazmat, can was dented and had a loose cap causing contents to leak out. Cans had no clips on the lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leakage cleaned with spill absorbent, no contact was made with human skin.
